item.title: 吉姆-宾为 F1 首次亮相的凯迪拉克增添美国精神
item.description: 肯塔基波本威士忌品牌吉姆-宾（Jim Beam）和一级方程式赛车新军凯迪拉克于本周三宣布建立合作伙伴关系，以彰显双方的历史渊源，并为车队增添美国精神。【原文：Kentucky bourbon brand Jim Beam and Formula One newcomers Cadillac announced a partnership on Wednesday highlighting their historic ties and adding to the team's American spirit.】

item.title: 台湾展示与美国军火制造商联合制造的首枚导弹
item.description: 台湾周三公布了与一家美国公司联合制造的首枚导弹，标志着台北与华盛顿为应对中国军事威胁而快速发展的防务合作迈出了重要一步。【原文：Taiwan unveiled its first missile to be jointly manufactured with a U.S. company on Wednesday, marking a major step in the fast-growing defence cooperation between Taipei and Washington to counter China's military threat.】

item.title: Rithm Capital 拟以 16 亿美元收购房地产投资信托公司派拉蒙集团
item.description: 全球资产管理公司 Rithm Capital 周三表示，已同意以 16 亿美元现金收购房地产投资信托公司派拉蒙集团。【原文：Global asset management company Rithm Capital on Wednesday said it had agreed to acquire real estate investment trust Paramount Group for $1.6 billion in cash.】

item.title: 博鳌亚洲论坛将美国最低时薪提高至 25 美元，兑现 2021 年承诺
item.description: 美国银行周三表示，已将全美最低时薪提高至每小时 25 美元，兑现了其 2021 年达到这一门槛的承诺。【原文：Bank of America raised its minimum hourly wage to $25 per hour across the United States, the lender said on Wednesday, fulfilling its 2021 pledge to meet the threshold.】

item.title: 芯片初创企业 Groq 以 69 亿美元估值融资 7.5 亿美元
item.description: 人工智能芯片初创公司 Groq 周三表示，该公司新融资 7.5 亿美元，融资后估值 69 亿美元。【原文：Artificial intelligence chip startup Groq said on Wednesday it has raised $750 million in new financing at a post-money valuation of $6.9 billion.】

item.title: 曼联连续第六年亏损，预计收入下降
item.description: 曼彻斯特联队（Manchester United）周三连续第六年报告年度净亏损，并预测本财年收入将减少，这凸显了这家足球俱乐部持续的财务困境。【原文：Manchester United reported an annual net loss for the sixth consecutive year on Wednesday and forecast lower revenue for this fiscal year, highlighting the football club's ongoing financial struggles.】

item.title: MBA 数据显示，美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率下降，再融资大幅增加
item.description: 随着就业增长放缓和美联储降息预期推动基准国债收益率下降，美国最受欢迎的住房贷款利率上周降至一年来的最低点，房主们竞相锁定更低的借贷成本。【原文：The interest rate on the most popular U.S. home loan dropped last week to its lowest in a year, sending homeowners racing to lock in cheaper borrowing costs as slowing jobs growth and expectations for a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut drive down yields on benchmark Treasuries.】

item.title: 通用磨坊公司季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 通用磨坊周三的季度销售额超出预期，原因是部分产品降价刺激了需求。【原文：General Mills beat quarterly sales estimates on Wednesday, as price cuts on select products lifted demand.】

item.title: 德意志银行将 2026 年黄金预期上调至 4,000 美元，金银屡创新高
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）周三将明年的金价预期上调了 300 美元，平均预期为每盎司 4,000 美元，原因是央行需求强劲、美元可能走软以及美联储重启加息周期。【原文：Deutsche Bank raised its gold price forecast by $300 for next year to an average of $4,000 per ounce on Wednesday, due to strong central bank demand, potential U.S. dollar weakness and a resumed Federal Reserve rate-easing cycle.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储翘首以盼，疲软美元获得支撑
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 非洲制造商为延长美国贸易计划做最后努力
item.description: 一位参与游说活动的肯尼亚工厂主告诉路透社，非洲制造商正在游说美国国会，希望能将将于 9 月底到期的免税贸易计划最后延长一到两年。【原文：African manufacturers are lobbying U.S. Congress to grant a last-ditch extension of one or two years to a duty-free trade programme due to expire at the end of September, a Kenyan factory owner involved in the campaign told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储降息可能为美股更广泛的上涨奠定基础
item.description: 投资者表示，美国央行恢复宽松货币政策可能会增加并扩大华尔街的涨势，尽管这种提振可能已经被定价，而且可能取决于较低的利率是否有助于经济避免大幅下滑。【原文：The resumption of monetary easing by the U.S. central bank could add to and broaden Wall Street's rally, investors say, though such a boost might already be priced in and could depend on whether lower interest rates help the economy avoid a significant downturn.】

item.title: 美联储有望降息，并通过新预测更新对特朗普经济计划的看法
item.description: 多年来政治色彩最浓厚的美国联邦储备委员会会议将于本周三结束，人们普遍预期这次会议将降息四分之一个百分点，但这可能会引发一些决策者的异议，他们认为降息幅度太小、为时过晚，而另一些决策者则认为根本没有必要降息。【原文：The most politically charged U.S. Federal Reserve meeting in years wraps up on Wednesday with broad expectations for a quarter-percentage-point interest rate cut that may spark dissents from some policymakers who feel it is too small and too late and others who feel it is not warranted at all.】

item.title: 联邦快递利润将受美国对此前豁免的包裹征收关税拖累
item.description: 联邦快递（FedEx）周四发布的财报显示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）决定终止对流行的直接面向消费者的货运免征关税待遇，这家全球快递公司的季度利润将受到冲击。【原文：FedEx will report a quarterly profit hit from President Donald Trump's decision to end tariff-exempt treatment for popular direct-to-consumer shipments when the global delivery firm reports results on Thursday, analysts said.】

item.title: 加拿大央行可能降息 25 个基点
item.description: 受疲软的就业报告和第二季度经济萎缩的刺激，加拿大央行预计将于周三降息 25 个基点。【原文：The Bank of Canada is expected to cut interest rates by 25 basis points on Wednesday, spurred by weak job reports and economic contraction in the second quarter.】

item.title: 美联储新预测将考虑动荡时期，米兰参与辩论
item.description: 美联储周三政策会议的结束将向投资者传递三方面的信息，显示官员们为应对就业市场疲软而重新调整展望的程度、美国央行在利率路径问题上的分歧有多大，以及行长斯蒂芬-米兰的上任是否让这一切有了党派倾向。【原文：The end of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting on Wednesday will convey a three-part message for investors, showing how much officials have reshuffled their outlooks to account for a weakening job market, how divided the U.S. central bank is becoming over the interest rate path and whether the arrival of Governor Stephen Miran has given it all a partisan tilt.】

item.title: 美国媒体行业新领军者 YouTube 将人工智能视为内容创作的关键
item.description: 在其 20 岁生日之际，YouTube 已无法辨认出当初那个由年轻的业余用户发布未经加工的低成本短片的零散视频网站。【原文：On its 20th birthday, YouTube is unrecognizable as the scrappy video site that began as the domain of young amateur users publishing unpolished, low-budget clips.】

item.title: 美联储将于 2025 年首次降息，美国各行业值得关注
item.description: 由于美联储有望在今年首次降低借贷成本，对利率敏感的美国企业部门将成为关注焦点，在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）上个月暗示将下调借贷成本后，大多数部门已经实现了上涨。【原文：U.S. corporate sectors that are sensitive to interest rates will be in focus as the Federal Reserve looks poised to lower borrowing costs for the first time this year, with most having already notched up gains after Chair Jerome Powell hinted at cuts last month.】

item.title: 美联储做出降息决定前谨慎情绪挥之不去，美国股指期货走势低迷
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货变化不大，因为投资者在等待美联储为期两天的货币政策路径评估会议之后发布公告的同时，暂缓了大额押注。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were little changed on Wednesday as investors held back on big bets while awaiting an announcement after the Federal Reserve's two-day meeting to assess the monetary policy path.】

item.title: 礼来制定以消费者为中心的战略，肥胖症药物领导地位将超越美国本土
item.description: 礼来公司国际总裁周三告诉路透社，礼来已在欧洲、亚洲和中东成为肥胖症药物市场的领导者，并希望在全球复制其在美国的主导地位。【原文：Eli Lilly has established itself as the market leader in obesity drugs in Europe, Asia and the Middle East and expects to replicate its U.S. dominance globally, the company's international president told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 世界贸易组织报告称，人工智能将改变全球贸易
item.description: 世界贸易组织周三的一份新报告警告说，到2040年，人工智能可将商品和服务贸易额提高近40%，但如果没有适当的政策，人工智能也可能加剧经济鸿沟。【原文：Artificial intelligence could boost the value of trade in goods and services by nearly 40% by 2040, but without adequate policies it could also exacerbate economic divides, a new World Trade Organization report warned on Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国商业银行首席执行官认为 "不友好 "的联合信贷银行交易可能导致收入减少
item.description: 德国商业银行首席执行官贝蒂娜-奥尔洛普（Bettina Orlopp）周三称，联合信贷银行（UniCredit）对潜在合并的态度 "不友好"，并表示任何交易都可能损害收入。【原文：Commerzbank CEO Bettina Orlopp on Wednesday labelled UniCredit's approach for a potential merger as "unfriendly" and said that any deal would likely hurt revenue.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚要求联合国航空机构制定保护飞机上宠物的全球标准
item.description: 在发生狗在飞机上死亡的高调事件后，哥伦比亚要求联合国航空机构支持宠物跨境空运的全球标准。【原文：Colombia is asking the U.N.'s aviation agency to support global standards for transporting pets by air across borders, following high-profile cases of dogs dying on planes.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：中国要求科技公司停止购买英伟达的所有人工智能芯片
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，中国互联网监管机构已指示中国最大的科技公司停止购买英伟达（Nvidia）的所有人工智能芯片，并终止现有订单。【原文：China's internet regulator has instructed the nation's biggest technology firms to stop buying all of Nvidia's artificial intelligence chips and terminate their existing orders, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息称威托尔和嘉能可将正式竞购雪佛龙新加坡炼油厂股份
item.description: 五位熟悉内情的人士透露，全球大宗商品贸易商维托尔（Vitol）和嘉能可（Glencore）有望正式竞购雪佛龙公司持有的新加坡第二大炼油厂 50%的股份。【原文：Global commodities traders Vitol and Glencore are expected to make formal bids for Chevron's 50% stake in Singapore's second-largest refinery, five people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 富士康互联合资公司将于 12 月开始在中东建厂
item.description: 富士康互联科技公司（FIT）的沙特阿拉伯合资企业将于 12 月开始建设其在中东的首个生产基地，该基地将生产电动汽车充电器。【原文：Foxconn Interconnect Technology's (FIT) 's Saudi Arabian joint venture will start constructing its first manufacturing base in the Middle East in December that will make electric vehicle chargers, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 礼来公司对使用 FDA 快速通道减重药券持谨慎态度
item.description: 礼来公司国际总裁周三表示，现在就断定该公司将对其试验性减肥药orforglipron采用美国食品和药物管理局新的快速审查程序还为时过早。【原文：Eli Lilly's international president said on Wednesday it was too early to assume the company would use the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's new fast-track review process for its experimental weight-loss pill orforglipron.】

item.title: 独家报道：阿达尼领导的斯里兰卡集装箱码头将在截止日期前将吞吐量提高一倍
item.description: 印度阿达尼集团（Adani Group）及其合作伙伴公司约翰-基尔斯控股公司（John Keells Holdings）的一位高管告诉路透社，尽管放弃了 5.53 亿美元的美国资金，但他们将提前数月把科伦坡一个耗资 8.4 亿美元的集装箱码头的吞吐量提高一倍。【原文：India's Adani Group and its partners are set to double the capacity of a $840 million container terminal in Colombo months ahead of schedule, despite relinquishing $553 million in U.S. funding, an executive at partner firm John Keells Holdings told Reuters.】

item.title: Stellantis因车门饰件脱落风险召回近16.4万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，Stellantis公司将在美国召回近16.4万辆吉普车，原因是这些车辆的驾驶员和乘客车门上的饰件可能会脱落。【原文：Stellantis is recalling nearly 164,000 Jeep vehicles in the U.S. due to issues causing a possible detachment of the trim on the driver and passenger doors, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯航天局局长承诺很快将为马斯克的 "星链"（Starlink）提供类似设备
item.description: 俄罗斯国家通讯社周三援引俄罗斯航天局局长德米特里-巴卡诺夫（Dmitry Bakanov）的话说，俄罗斯将很快拥有与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的卫星互联网服务 "星链"（Starlink）类似的服务。【原文：Russia will soon have an analogue to Elon Musk's satellite internet service Starlink, Dmitry Bakanov, the head of Russia's Roscosmos space agency was quoted by state news agencies as saying on Wednesday.】
